meanings.definition: The large bony structure near the base of the spine that connects the trunk of the body to the legs.
meanings.sent1: Doctors study pelvises to understand how our bodies are connected.
meanings.sent2: She felt pain in her pelvises after the long hike.
meanings.sent3: The pelvises at the museum looked like giant puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's pelvises moved gracefully with each step.
meanings.sent5: The weightlifter's strong pelvises supported heavy lifting.

meanings.definition: The plural form of pelvis, referring to more than one of these structures.
meanings.sent1: In the anatomy class, students learned about different types of pelvises.
meanings.sent2: The X-ray showed two fractured pelvises from the accident.
meanings.sent3: At the zoo, the pelvises of the hippos caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The construction workers carefully lifted the heavy pelvises into place.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologists discovered ancient pelvises buried in the ground.
